error.bluetooth_integration_required: Bluetooth integration is required to configure Skelly Ultra
error.rest_server_unreachable: Cannot connect to Skelly Ultra REST server. Please ensure the server is running at the specified URL.
error.rest_server_error: REST server returned an error. Please check the server is running correctly.
error.address_required: Device address is required in manual mode

data_description.use_ble_proxy: Enable this to connect via REST server instead of direct BLE (useful for remote access or systems without BLE hardware)
data_description.mode: Choose 'scan' to discover nearby devices, or 'manual' to enter the address directly
data_description.address: MAC address of the Skelly device (required in manual mode, optional when scanning)
data_description.server_url: URL of the Skelly Ultra REST server. Required for proxy mode and live mode features (default: http://localhost:8765)

server_warning.title: REST server not running
server_warning.description: The REST server could not be reached. The integration will work for basic control, but live mode will not be available. See documentation: {docs_url}

data.acknowledged: I understand that live mode will not be available

enable_classic_bt.name: Enable classic Bluetooth
enable_classic_bt.description: Make the Skelly Ultra expose a classic Bluetooth speaker to connect to for live mode.

play_file.name: Play file
play_file.description: Play a file from the device's internal storage by file index.

file_index.name: File index
file_index.description: The 1-based index of the file to play (must be at least 1).

stop_file.name: Stop file
stop_file.description: Stop a file that is currently playing on the device by file index.

file_index.name: File index
file_index.description: The 1-based index of the file to stop (must be at least 1).

cancel_file_transfer.name: Cancel file transfer
cancel_file_transfer.description: Cancel an ongoing file upload to the device.

send_file.name: Send file
send_file.description: Upload an audio file to the device. The file will be automatically converted to 8kHz mono MP3 format if needed. Supports local files and HTTP/HTTPS URLs, including Home Assistant media files (/media/...).

file_path.name: File path
file_path.description: Path to the audio file. Can be a local file path, HTTP/HTTPS URL, or Home Assistant media path (/media/...).

target_filename.name: Target filename
target_filename.description: Name to save the file as on the device (without extension). The .mp3 extension will be added automatically.

delete_file.name: Delete file
delete_file.description: Delete a file from the Skelly device's internal storage. The file can be specified either by file_index and cluster (both required), or by filename. The service will refresh the file list before and after the delete operation.

device_id.name: Device ID
device_id.description: The device registry ID of the Skelly device to target.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: An entity ID associated with the device. If provided, the device_id will be derived from this entity.

file_index.name: File index
file_index.description: The 0-based index of the file to delete. Must be used together with cluster. Mutually exclusive with filename.

cluster.name: Cluster
cluster.description: The cluster value of the file to delete. Must be used together with file_index. Mutually exclusive with filename.

filename.name: Filename
filename.description: The name of the file to delete (e.g., 'announcement.mp3'). The service will look up the corresponding file_index and cluster. Mutually exclusive with file_index and cluster.
